isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING COMPRESSOR AND CLUTCH TWO CYLINDER RECIPROCATING TYPE - BEFORE 01/01/1993 (R-12) - REMOVE AND INSTALL - VALVE PLATE ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Remove the hexhead capscrews securing the compressor cylinder head to crankcase. Using a 12-point socket, remove the remaining capscrews near the system hose connections.

Remove the cylinder head and valve plate by gently prying or tapping with a soft rubber hammer under the ears that extend from the valve plate ( Figure 20and Figure 21). If the cylinder head and valve plate stick to each other, hold the head and tap the valve plate ears away from the head with a rubber hammer.

figure.caption: Figure 20. Removing Cylinder Head From Compressor

caution.para: Do not hit or tap the cylinder head to separate it from the valve as damage may result.

step1.para: Apply a thin film of the type of refrigerant oil used in the system to the area of the crankcase covered by the cylinder gasket. Place the gasket on the cylinder so the dowel pins in the crankcase go through the dowel pin holes in the cylinder gasket.

Apply a thin coat of the type of refrigerant oil used in the system to the bottom side of the valve plate areas contacting the cylinder gasket. Place the valve plate in position on the cylinder gasket so the discharge valve assemblies (the smaller diameter valves with the retainer over the valve reed) are facing up and the locating dowel pins go through the dowel pin holes in the valve plate.

Place the head gasket on the valve plate so the dowel pins go through the dowel pin holes in the gasket. Place the head on the cylinder head gasket so the dowel pins go into the dowel pin holes in the cylinder head.

Secure the cylinder head using eight hex head capscrews and four 12-point head capscrews. See Figure 22 for proper placement of capscrews and tightening sequence. Tighten to 15 to 23 ft-lbs. (20 to 31 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 22. Cylinder Head Capscrew Tightening Sequence

step1.para: Install service port caps finger tight to prevent the entry of dirt or foreign matter. Install oil fill plug with new O-ring seal. Tighten to 4 to 11 ft-lbs. (5 to 15 N•m).
